data.title: Restaurant Week Fail.
data.text: We chose this restaurant based on some of the menu selections.    It is restaurant week and we understood there was a price fix menu.   I checked with the server and explained that I could not have sugar.  I asked if it was possible to do two of the first courses instead of a dessert course.  After asking, the server reported no.   It did not make sense then for one of us to get three courses.  We had already ordered wine and could not leave.  We both ordered entrees.  Service was quite slow.   I asked for prawn tacos.  They were cold.  My husband ordered the sliders and fries.  The fries were cold.  We will not be recommending this nor returning.

data.title: Eecellent , Gem!!!
data.text: Had a group of 10 for a friends birthday and  Red Restaurant and Bar delivered an a,amazing experience. The service was casual, on point and super friendly. The food was amazing, squid ink risotto and brussel sprout chips, cream cheese won tons, excellent small selection of wines and an out standing bar selection. The age range was from young 20's to hipsters and 40 somethings like myself, i would not bring my grand parents here, but I was a great experience, will be back for sure!

data.title: Quiet early and hoppin' late
data.text: An early dinner at Red was the perfect quiet spot in our attempt to escape the hectic pace of the boardwalk.  Up old carpeted stairs,   the stately hardwood bar, with red glowing sconces and candles, and a comfy spread of upholstered couches and sofas strewn with plush pillows is inviting and comfortable.  Beveled windows frame window tables, and a stone fireplace opens to both sides, offering additional seatings for intimate groups. The menu is eclectic and affordable.  We chose our beers with difficulty from the expansive list of craft beers, and ended up dining simply on appetizers.  We chose truffled and rosemary french fries, which were hot and flavorful.  Roasted jalapeños stuffed with cheeses was a fresh departure from the normally greasy fried style, and our last dish of cucumbers and tempura shrimp was fresh, hot, sweet and crunchy all at once.  Our bill was reasonable, the service was friendly and we would definitely go back.  Not fancy, but fun.  The quiet ambiance fades about 8PM when lines can form out the door, but that is not when I would choose to go!

data.title: Great place to grab a bite late at night
data.text: The red is the sort of bar that offers good food and drinks at a late time, while offering pub atmosphere. Sure it gets dicey every so often but I've never had a problem. The steak salad and the fries are ridiculously good and hit the spot when you are out and there is no place to eat.

data.title: Awesome spot for a cocktail
data.text:
This is a nice spot to grab a cocktail at the end of a busy tourist day or after work.  We got there about 430pm, the place was pretty empty.  We picked a spot at the far end of the room at one of the dining tables.  About an hour later, the locals started to wander in and the place was over half full by the time we left at 6pm; Thursday night.  

They do offer a nice selection of food.  We had the jalapeno poppers and the lamb balls appetizers.  Both dishes were very tasty and the portions were not overwhelming.

I ordered a Boulevardier and my boyfriend ordered one of their house cocktails.  Both drinks were well executed.  My test is to order the same drink and see if they pour and mix as close to the quality of the first drink.  I was not disappointed; whomever mixed my two drinks did an exceptional job.  My boyfriend opted for his preferred Bombay martini and he was happy.  

This was the "chill" that we were looking for at the start of our vacation.  If we lived in the area we would definitely meet up with friends after work here.

data.title: What a gem...
data.text: We lived in Santa Cruz County for almost 6 years and have never been to this restaurant until last week.This restaurant is upstairs in the Old Santa Cruz Hotel...the architecture of the building is worth a visit on its own...and the architecture adds to the cool vibe old school ambiance.  It has a fireplace and lots of lounge seating areas that are perfect for hanging out with friends, drinking a negroni especially when it's raining outside...loved appetizers especially the jalapeno poppers that were not deep fried-so fresh tasting!  And don't forget to try the chicken and waffles...yes, they have this on their menu. Service was EXCELLENT! Very engaging and fun to talk with.  They were super intuitive.  Couldn't ask for a better night out with friends...

data.title: Cristmast white elefant party
data.text: Really nice food,nice place to meet friends and have a nice time together, truffle frys are awesome. And service very good highly recommended to meet friends and have a good  time together

data.title: Red Reataurant is a green light for dinner and drinks
data.text:
I stopped by the Red Restaurant for Restaurant Week and found a new favorite.  I got the steak entre and it was the best steak I have had since moving to Santa Cruz 20 years ago!   The wait staff was excellent and helpful.  Since I have a bazillion allergies this is a critical point and they were so helpful.  
Also, the atmosphere was a delight as well.  
Thanks Red for being a new favorit

data.title: Fabulous Food for Restaurant Week, slow service
data.text:
We went to Red for the last day of Restaurant Week.  We did not have a reservation and they were very friendly and accommodating about not having a table but offered to serve us in the bar.  We really wanted a dining experience so asked to wait for an available table.   They made us feel welcome while we waited and the wait was pretty short, and we were seated at a very comfortable table.  The chairs are padded and as comfortable as the expensive ones I bought for my own dining room table.  This was a nice surprise as it seems many restaurants have such uncomfortable chairs. 

The food was awesome from start to finish for our meal.  We started with some excellent Onion rings for an appetizer.   For our first course I started off with the Laap Salad and my wife had the Caesar salad. We shared plates and both agreed that each salad was exceptional.  We have had Caesar salads everywhere for years, but this one stood out as one of the best we have had anywhere.  The Laap salad was unique with Thai type flavors and steak.  A surprising and different salad but a great treat as well.

The service to this point had been slow, but tolerable because the food was so good and the staff was friendly and happy.  Then our waitress confessed there had been a technical problem with our order, so it would be another 20 minutes.  This would not have been a big deal except the pace of dinner had been so slow to this point.  I give the waitress loads of credit because for one she was honest and didn't avoid us at all even knowing we would not be happy.  She also brought us an order of fantastic french fries to snack while we waited and comped us a round of drinks to boot.  I give her and her manager top marks for caring about their customers and making it right. I would return here based on this good service and the fantastic food assures I will come back.  

For our main course we both had the filet mignon, and again we agreed it was one of the absolute best steaks I have had in some time.  Wrapped in bacon, cooked to perfection and super tender.  It had a light port wine reduction and was served with the most awesome creamy mashed potatoes.  My only complaint would be I wished there was more of those yummy potatoes......  and that is hardly a complaint...

Our meal was topped off with some great desserts but we had to take them to go, because of the other couple we were with had kids to attend to at home, and the meal had taken so long.  

Overall I give this place top marks. I hope they can make the adjustments to have a little better pace of service because to us the food was special and by far the best of four restaurants we tried for Restaurant Week.

data.title: Drinks and appetizers delight
data.text: Creative and delicious! Loved the jalapeño appetizers, Brussels sprout chips, and fun cocktails. This might be the best beet salad I've ever had, topped with crispy golden beets and goat cheese.

data.title: You guys are excellent, but...
data.text: You need to not hold on to people's ID cards, because if you forget to give them back to people who are not used to leaving theirs with the bar, they will forget and have to drive a long distance sometimes with no time in their schedule to get it back from you.

data.title: Verbally assaulted, flipped off, and 86'd for asking why there is a $5 charge for a hat.
data.text:
I've called repeatedly this evening but your staff apparently doesn't care about picking up the phone during business hours.

My guest and I were verbally assaulted and harassed by your staff at the door. Over a hat. It was totally okay for them to verbally assault us, flip us the bird, and cuss us out because we questioned them about a $5 charge for a hat. Your staff humiliated my guest and I. I have been coming to your establishment since I was 18 years old. I am in my thirties. I have never been charged for an article of clothing, nor should my 53 year old guest be verbally assaulted and flipped off over a Royal Caribbean baseball cap (It looks soooo gang banger /s).

The kicker? They let in a shirtless drunk that could barely walk in ahead of us. THAT WAS TOTALLY OKAY!!!

The general manager needs to call me ASAP. I'm not going to let this drop. I have never been so humiliated by  someone who is supposed to be focused on CUSTOMER SERVICE in my life.

data.title: dinner before a concert
data.text: Good service, very well prepared food. But they substituted a different fish for the one I ordered without mentioning it.  I was surprised to receive salmon instead, but it was perfectly prepared so I did not object in that we were going to a concert.

data.title: 5 stars for cocktails, 3 stars for food
data.text: The food is only very average but the cocktails are great! The Jean Grey is my favorite (earl grey infused gin, fresh squeezed lemon, simple syrup served up with a sugar rim). Go at night for a cozy feel with the rugs and couches. In the daytime its too easy to see all the stains on them.

data.title: Great lounge for some late night drinks and good music
data.text: My boyfriend and I came here to meet up with some friends for drinks around 11pm.  The DJs and the vibe were great.  It was an eclectic mix of music including pop, hip hop, reggae, and some 90s music.  I had a deliciously refreshing cucumber mojito.  It's also a diverse crowd in terms of age and ethnicity.

data.title: Incredibly Dirty With Horrible Food
data.text: One of the worst restaurants to eat at in Santa Cruz. The entire room smells of vomit and spilled drinks,  the floor is covered in gum and grease, and the furniture is run down and or broken.  The food was horrible, cold and questionable it was reheated. The hamburgers where flavorless. The buns crumbly, wet and thick with grease.  The best part of the meal were the sweet potato fries by they cost $2 extra on $14 hamburger.  The entire wait staff was either stoned or hungover. They did a fine job if you don't mind waiting long periods of time for simple tasks.  They beer selection is good, the drink selection is good however, poorly prepared and do even bother with the wine. (which was expected)

data.title: Romantic ambiance but poor drinks
data.text: I was there with a group and ordered a martini with a twist.  I got an alcoholic beverage that was clear, but it tasted like the shaker hadn't been rinsed or cleaned between drinks.  I asked for a remake and the second drink was even worse.

data.title: Daughters 21st birthday
data.text: Went w/my daughter and her friends for her 21st BD and we had fun as this is a totally relaxing environment.

data.title: Cozy and dark
data.text: Great place for an after work get-together or late night drinks.

data.title: Great place to go with a group of friends.
data.text: I went to red room with a group of 6 friends for drinks and food on a Friday night. The restaurant/ bar was packed and lively. We had called ahead for a reservation, but the table ahead of us was not done their meal when we got their. They sat us on some cozy couches and served us our drinks. It took a while for the beverages to arrive, but the cocktails were worth the wait. We also orders some tasty fries while we waited for our table. After a moderate wait we were seated, and the entrees which we had ordered while waitin for the table arrived shortly after. The food was pretty good all around but some stood out more than others. I had the hanger steak sandwich which was very good. The best thing about this bar/ restaurant was its live music. They had a fantastic hip hop dj and two incredible vocalists performing with him. I was just passing through, but if I knew this bar had live music every weekend I would make this a must stop in Santa Cruz.
